comment: Mr. Miller is a great calculus professor. He explained everything very well and helped if you didn't understand fully. He is accessible outside of class easily. Has a few tests and quizzes along with online homework. Gives good extra credit. I was struggling early on, but once you get the flow you'll be fine and I ended with a good A and aced final

He's good at teaching other math material but just not educ math. He made us learn the base of 6 math, which is difficult if there aren't many resources. He never really gave us a straight answer to simple questions we asked. No study guide so you just had to take the chance. His test and material shown in class don't add up. I don't recommend him

From the first day of class until now, he has been nothing but a great professor. He is very active in the group me as he constantly provides us with help if we need it and practice problems for the quizzes.

I like how this Prof. was very active in our group me. He would be relating to the students and doing his best to help. He asked us to show work for test only but it ended up being helpful bc it really does help to get points back on a test. We even got some points back on quizzes too. Really nice prof. 5/5
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I had a rocky start, but once I figured out where I needed the most help he was there. Attend his office hours even if you don't feel as if you need them!! It's a great way to let him know you care about your grade ( from personal experience he's more inclined to help when he sees this). I wouldn't say the textbook was necessary, but it could help.

There are weekly homework assignments, three tests, and six quizzes. All assignments are done through Pearson's Math Lab. Professor Miller is quick to respond and offer help. At the end of every assignment, he gives extra credit. The class is super flexible. Professor Miller makes the class easy to understand. TAKE HIM!!!!

Gave a GroupMe for the class and was active in it. If you had a question, he would answer it. There is weekly homework, which is usual. 3 tests and a final exam with 6 quizzes. He will ALWAYS go back and check your work just in case the online grading messes up, which saved a lot of people in this class. Gave extra credit at the end too! Take him.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: I am so glad that my first math class, which was calculus 1, was taught by him. He is such an amazing professor, very caring, and willing to repeat a concept if you ask him to do so. I would recommend him 100%

Best Calc teacher I've had so far at KSU. Explains everything in detail step by step, especially when asked. If you miss a quiz in his class, you will be able to take it another day without penalty. He is a nice dude too, so class isn't dry.

He was a decent professor. He tries to make the class funny with dad jokes, but his lectures can sometimes be all over the place. We weren't allowed to use technology so all notes are handwritten and he uses the whiteboard. There is a quiz almost every friday, but he drops the lowest 3 quiz grades. Homework every class, and 3 tests and the final.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: He can be a little frustrating, but overall teaches pretty well and is easy to get along with. Good choice.
Doesn't really go in depth with any topics so you'll have to do a lot of solo learning.
